Use candles: Candles are a classic and timeless way to light up a room. You can place them on tables, shelves, and windows to create a warm and cozy atmosphere.
Use natural light: If the room has windows away from the sun, you can use natural light to your advantage by opening the curtains and blinds to let in some light.
Use a portable solar-powered lantern: Solar-powered lanterns are a great alternative to traditional lighting fixtures. You can charge them during the day and use them to light up a room at night.
Use glow-in-the-dark plants: Glow-in-the-dark plants are a fun and unique way to add light to a room. They can be placed in or on shelves to create a soft, ambient glow.

Use a fireplace or wood-burning stove: If your home has a fireplace or wood-burning stove, you can use it to create a warm and inviting atmosphere in a room. You can also use it to cook a meal or make some hot drinks to enjoy while you relax.
